    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 3 &amp;#150; SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT&#13;ACCOUNTING 
POLICIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basis of presentation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial&#13;statements are prepared 
in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States
of America (&amp;#147;US&#13;GAAP&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basis of consolidation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The consolidated financial statements&#13;include the accounts of 
the Company and its subsidiary. All inter-company accounts and transactions have
been eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 
13, 2015, the Company disposed&#13;of its 100% equity interest in Apolo Gold 
Direct Limited (formerly known as Apolo Gold&amp;#38; Energy Asia Limited), a 
company incorporated&#13;in Hong Kong, to Mr. Kelvin Chak, the Chief Executive 
Officer (&amp;#147;CEO&amp;#148;) and director of the Company, Mr. Tsap Wai 
Ping,&#13;the brother of the CEO and China Yi Gao Gold Trader Co., Limited, a 
company incorporated in Hong Kong, for a consideration of $100.&#13;For the year
ended June 30, 2015, there was no gain or loss recognized on the disposal of a 
subsidiary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Estimates&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Management 
uses estimates and assumptions&#13;in preparing these financial statements in 
accordance with US GAAP. Those estimates and assumptions affect the reported 
amounts&#13;of assets and liabilities, the disclosure of contingent assets and 
liabilities in the balance sheet, and the reported revenue and&#13;expenses 
during the periods reported. Actual results may differ from these 
estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash and cash 
equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cash and cash 
equivalents are carried&#13;at cost and represent cash on hand, demand deposits 
placed with banks or other financial institutions and all highly liquid 
investments&#13;with an original maturity of three months or less as of the 
purchase date of such investments.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Investments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Affiliated 
companies, in which the Company&#13;has significant influence, but no control, 
are accounted for investment. Investment adjustments include the 
Company&amp;#146;s proportionate&#13;share of investee income or loss, gains or 
losses resulting from investee capital transactions, adjustments to recognize 
certain&#13;differences between the Company&amp;#146;s carrying value and the 
Company&amp;#146;s equity in net assets of the investee at the date&#13;of 
investment, impairments, and other adjustments required by the equity method. 
Gain or losses are realized when such investments&#13;are 
sold.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Stock-based 
compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company adopts FASB 
Accounting Standards&#13;Codification Topic 718, &lt;i&gt;Compensation 
&amp;#150; Stock Compensation &lt;/i&gt;(&amp;#147;ASC Topic 718&amp;#148;) 
using the fair value method.&#13;Under ASC Topic 718, the stock-based 
compensation is measured using the Black-Scholes Option-Pricing model on the 
date of grant&#13;under the modified prospective method. The fair value of 
stock-based compensation that are expected to vest are recognized using&#13;the 
straight-line method over the requisite service period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Income taxes are determined in accordance&#13;with the provisions of
ASC Topic 740, &amp;#147;Income Taxes&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASC Topic 
740&amp;#148;). Under this method, deferred tax&#13;assets and liabilities are 
recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between 
the financial statement&#13;carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities 
and their respective tax basis. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are 
measured&#13;using enacted income tax rates expected to apply to taxable income 
in the periods in which those temporary differences are expected&#13;to be 
recovered or settled. Any effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a 
change in tax rates is recognized in income&#13;in the period that includes the 
enactment date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;ASC 740 prescribes a 
comprehensive model&#13;for how companies should recognize, measure, present, 
and disclose in their financial statements uncertain tax positions taken&#13;or 
expected to be taken on a tax return. Under ASC 740, tax positions must 
initially be recognized in the financial statements&#13;when it is more likely 
than not the position will be sustained upon examination by the tax authorities.
Such tax positions must&#13;initially and subsequently be measured as the 
largest amount of tax benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being 
realized&#13;upon ultimate settlement with the tax authority assuming full 
knowledge of the position and relevant facts.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Net loss per share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company calculates net loss per&#13;share in accordance with ASC
Topic 260, &lt;i&gt;&amp;#147;Earnings per Share.&amp;#148;&lt;/i&gt; Basic loss
per share is computed by dividing the&#13;net loss by the weighted-average 
number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted income per share
 is computed similar&#13;to basic loss per share except that the denominator is 
increased to include the number of additional common shares that would 
have&#13;been outstanding if the potential common stock equivalents had been 
issued and if the additional common shares were 
dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Comprehensive 
income&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;ASC Topic 220, 
&amp;#147;Comprehensive&#13;Income&amp;#148;, establishes standards for 
reporting and display of comprehensive income, its components and accumulated 
balances.&#13;Comprehensive income as defined includes all changes in equity 
during a period from non-owner sources. Accumulated other 
comprehensive&#13;income, as presented in the accompanying consolidated 
statement of stockholders&amp;#146; equity, consists of changes in 
unrealized&#13;gains and losses on foreign currency translation. This 
comprehensive income is not included in the computation of income tax 
expense&#13;or benefit.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Related 
parties&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Parties, which can be a 
corporation&#13;or individual, are considered to be related if the Company has 
the ability, directly or indirectly, to control the other party&#13;or exercise 
significant influence over the other party in making financial and operating 
decisions. Companies are also considered&#13;to be related if they are subject 
to common control or common significant influence.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair value of financial 
instruments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The carrying value of 
the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;financial instruments: cash and cash equivalents, 
subscription receivable, notes receivable, accounts payable and loans from 
related&#13;parties approximate at their fair values because of the short-term 
nature of these financial instruments.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company 
also follows the guidance&#13;of the ASC Topic 820-10, &amp;#147;Fair Value 
Measurements and Disclosures&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASC 820-10&amp;#148;), with 
respect to financial&#13;assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value.
ASC 820-10 establishes a three-tier fair value hierarchy that 
prioritizes&#13;the inputs used in measuring fair value as 
follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
31.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Level 1&lt;/i&gt;: Observable&#13;inputs such as quoted 
prices in active markets;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Level 2&lt;/i&gt;: Inputs, other&#13;than the quoted prices
in active markets, that are observable either directly or indirectly; 
and&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Level 3&lt;/i&gt;: Unobservable&#13;inputs in 
which there is little or no market data, which require the reporting entity to 
develop its own assumptions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Foreign 
currency translation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Transactions denominated
in currencies&#13;other than the functional currency are translated into the 
functional currency at the exchange rates prevailing at the dates of&#13;the 
transaction. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other 
than the functional currency are translated into&#13;the functional currency 
using the applicable exchange rates at the balance sheet dates. The resulting 
exchange differences are&#13;recorded in the statement of 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The reporting currency
of the Company&#13;is United States Dollars (&amp;#147;US$&amp;#148;) and the 
accompanying financial statements have been expressed in US$. In 
addition,&#13;the Company&amp;#146;s former subsidiary in Hong Kong maintains 
its books and record in its local currency, Hong Kong Dollars 
(&amp;#147;HK$&amp;#148;),&#13;which is functional currency as being the primary
currency of the economic environment in which the entity 
operates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In general, for 
consolidation purposes,&#13;assets and liabilities of its subsidiaries whose 
functional currency is not US$ are translated into US$, in accordance with 
ASC&#13;Topic 830-30, &amp;#147;Translation of Financial Statement&amp;#148;, 
using the exchange rate on the balance sheet date. Revenues and&#13;expenses are
translated at average rates prevailing during the period. The gains and losses 
resulting from translation of financial&#13;statements of foreign subsidiary are
recorded as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income 
within the statement&#13;of stockholders&amp;#146; equity. The gains and losses 
are recorded as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive 
income&#13;within the statement of stockholders&amp;#146; 
equity.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Translation of amounts 
from HK$ into&#13;US$1 has been made at the following exchange rates for the 
respective periods:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0"

Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;FASB issues various 
Accounting Standards&#13;Updates relating to the treatment and recording of 
certain accounting transactions. On June 10, 2014, the Financial 
Accounting&#13;Standards Board issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU) No. 
2014-10,Development Stage Entities (Topic 915) - Elimination of 
Certain&#13;Financial Reporting Requirements, Including an Amendment to Variable
Interest Entities Guidance in Topic 810, Consolidation, which&#13;eliminates the
concept of a development stage entity (DSE) entirely from current accounting 
guidance. The Company has elected adoption&#13;of this standard, which 
eliminates the designation of DSEs and the requirement to disclose results of 
operations and cash flows&#13;since inception.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company has reviewed all recently&#13;issued, but not yet 
effective, accounting pronouncements and do not believe the future adoption of 
any such pronouncements may&#13;be expected to cause a material impact on its 
financial condition or the results of its operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-

01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p

0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 11, 2013, 
the Company entered&#13;into a sale agreement with Yinfu Gold Corp. 
(&amp;#147;Yinfu&amp;#148;) to acquire 70% interest in three gold exploration 
claims located&#13;in Xinjian Province, the PRC. The Company issued 6,000,000 
shares of restricted common stock at $0.20 per share to the wholly 
owned&#13;subsidiary of Yinfu in payment of $1,200,000 for the 
acquisition.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On January 19, 2015, the
Company and&#13;Yinfu reached a mutual agreement to terminate the acquisition of
the 70% interest in the three gold exploration claims in the PRC.&#13;All 
6,000,000 shares of restricted common stock were returned and cancelled at the 
current market value of $0.10 per share and&#13;an investment loss of $600,000 
was resulted.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As
of June 30, 2015, the Company does&#13;not hold any mineral property exploration
claims.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:MineralIndustriesDisclosuresTextBlock>

Officer (&amp;#147;CEO&amp;#148;) and director of the Company, Mr. Tsap Wai 
Ping,&#13;the brother of the CEO and China Yi Gao Gold Trader Co., Limited, a

ended June 30, 2015, there was no gain or loss recognized on the disposal of a
subsidiary.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock>

    <us-gaap:InvestmentHoldingsTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 5 &amp;#150; 
INVESTMENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
December 23, 2013, the Company entered&#13;into an Asset Sale &amp;#38; Purchase
Agreement with Mr. Tang Wenbo (&amp;#147;Mr. Tang&amp;#148;) to acquire Mr. 
Tang&amp;#146;s 24% equity&#13;interest and assets in Jiangxi Everenergy New 
Material Co., Ltd. (&amp;#147;Everenergy&amp;#148;). The Company issued 
8,000,000 shares&#13;of restricted common stock of the Company at $0.375 per 
share and paid $1,000,000 for the aggregate payment of $4,000,000 for 
the&#13;acquisition.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 19, 2014, 
the Company entered&#13;into an Asset Sale &amp;#38; Purchase Agreement with Mr.
Hu Qinjian (&amp;#147;Mr. Hu&amp;#148;) to acquire Mr. Hu&amp;#146;s 29% equity 
interest&#13;and assets in Everenergy. The Company issued 11,000,000 shares of 
restricted common stock of the Company at $0.45 per share for&#13;the 
consideration of $4,950,000 for the acquisition.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
September 17, 2014, the Company terminated&#13;the Asset Sale &amp;#38; Purchase
Agreements with Mr. Tang and Mr. Hu for the acquisition of 24% and 29% equity 
interest and assets&#13;in Everenergy, respectively due to neither Mr. Tang, Mr.
Hu and Everenergy had complied various terms and conditions of the 
Asset&#13;Sale &amp;#38; Purchase Agreement. On the same day, the Board of 
Directors approved the cancellation of all 19,000,000 shares of 
restricted&#13;common stock at a current market value of $0.12 per share. On 
October 21, 2014, 11,000,000 shares of restricted common stock were&#13;returned
and effectively cancelled and the remaining 8,000,000 shares are to be cancelled
as of June 30, 2015. For the year ended&#13;June 30, 2015, the Company could not
recover the $1,000,000 cash payment and a total investment loss of $6,670,000 
was resulted.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As
of June 30, 2015, the Company does&#13;not hold any investments.&lt;/p&gt;</us-

ignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 1 &amp;#150; ORGANIZATION AND DESCRIPTION&#13;OF 
BUSINESS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Wincash Apolo Gold &amp;#38; Energy, Inc.
(&amp;#147;the&#13;Company&amp;#148;) was incorporated in March of 1997 under 
the laws of the State of Nevada primarily for the purpose of acquiring&#13;and 
developing mineral properties. The Company conducts operations primarily from 
its administrative offices in Vancouver, British&#13;Columbia, 
Canada.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 11, 2013, 
the Company entered&#13;into a sale agreement with Yinfu Gold Corp. 
(&amp;#147;Yinfu&amp;#148;) to acquire 70% interest in three gold exploration 
claims located&#13;in Xinjian Province, the People&amp;#146;s Republic of China 
(the &amp;#147;PRC&amp;#148;). The Company issued 6,000,000 shares of 
restricted&#13;common stock of the Company at $0.20 per share for the 
consideration of $1,200,000. On January 19, 2015, the Company and 
Yinfu&#13;reached a mutual agreement to terminate the acquisition at the current
market value of $0.10 per share and an investment loss of&#13;$600,000 was 
resulted.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 23, 2013, 
the Company entered&#13;into an Asset Sale &amp;#38; Purchase Agreement with Mr.
Tang Wenbo (&amp;#147;Mr. Tang&amp;#148;) to acquire Mr. Tang&amp;#146;s 24% 
equity&#13;interest and assets in Jiangxi Everenergy New Material Co., Ltd. 
(&amp;#147;Everenergy&amp;#148;). The Company issued 8,000,000 shares&#13;of 
restricted common stock of the Company at $0.375 per share and paid $1,000,000 
for the aggregate consideration of $4,000,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
February 19, 2014, the Company entered&#13;into an Asset Sale &amp;#38; Purchase
Agreement with Mr. Hu Qinjian (&amp;#147;Mr. Hu&amp;#148;) to acquire Mr. 
Hu&amp;#146;s 29% equity interest&#13;and assets in Everenergy. The Company 
issued 11,000,000 shares of restricted common stock of the Company at $0.45 per 
share for&#13;the consideration of $4,950,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
September 17, 2014, the Company terminated&#13;the Asset Sale &amp;#38; Purchase
Agreements with Mr. Tang and Mr. Hu for the acquisition of 24% and 29% equity 
interest and assets&#13;in Everenergy, respectively due to neither Mr. Tang, Mr.
Hu or Everenergy had complied various terms and conditions of the Asset&#13;Sale
&amp;#38; Purchase Agreement. On the same day, the Board of Directors approved 
the cancellation of the total 19,000,000 shares&#13;of restricted common stock 
at the current market value of $0.12 per share. On October 21, 2014, 11,000,000 
shares were returned&#13;and effectively cancelled and the remaining 8,000,000 
shares are to be cancelled on June 30, 2015. For the year ended June 
30,&#13;2015, the Company could not recover the $1,000,000 cash payment and a 
total investment loss of $6,670,000 was resulted.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
February 13, 2015, the Company disposed&#13;its 100% equity interest in Apolo
Gold Direct Limited (formerly known as Apolo Gold &amp;#38; Energy Asia Limited)
to Mr. Kelvin Chak,&#13;the Chief Executive Officer (&amp;#147;CEO&amp;#148;) 
and director of the Company, Mr. Tsap Wai Ping, the brother of the CEO and 
China&#13;Yi Gao Gold Trader Co., Limited, a company incorporated in Hong Kong, 
for a consideration of $100. For the year ended June, 30,&#13;2015, there was no
gain or loss recognized on the disposal of a 
subsidiary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 18, 2015, the 
Company filed&#13;an Amendment to its Articles of Incorporation with the Nevada 
Secretary of State to change its name from Apolo Gold &amp;#38; Energy,&#13;Inc.
to Wincash Apolo Gold &amp;#38; Energy, Inc.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company will continue to anticipate&#13;potential mineral 
property exploration and other energy related investments. As of June 30, 2015, 
the Company does not hold any&#13;mineral property exploration 
claims.&lt;/p&gt;</us-

    <APLL:GoingConcernUncertaintiesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 2 &amp;#150; GOING CONCERN 
UNCERTAINTIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying 
consolidated financial&#13;statements have been prepared assuming that the 
Company will continue as a going concern. As of June 30, 2015, the Company 
suffered&#13;an accumulated deficit of $15,436,321 and the Company had generated
limited revenue and had no committed sources of capital or&#13;financing for the
reporting period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;These consolidated 
financial statements&#13;have been prepared assuming that the Company will 
continue as a going concern, which contemplates the realization of assets 
and&#13;the discharge of liabilities in the normal course of business for the 
foreseeable future.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of June 30, 2015, the
Company suffered&#13;the accumulated deficits of $15,436,321 from prior years 
and suffered from a working capital deficit of $20,288. The continuation&#13;of 
the Company as a going concern is dependent upon the continuing financial 
support from its stockholders or external financing.&#13;Management believes the
existing stockholders will provide the additional cash to meet with the 
Company&amp;#146;s obligations as&#13;they become due. However, there can be no 
assurance that the Company will be able to obtain sufficient funds to meet its 
obligations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent:
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;These factors raise 
substantial doubt&#13;about the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a 
going concern. These consolidated financial statements do not include any 
adjustments&#13;to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability and
classification of assets or the amounts and classification of&#13;liabilities 
that may result in the Company not being able to continue as a going 
concern.&lt;/p&gt;</APLL:GoingConcernUncertaintiesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <APLL:DueToDirectorDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 6 &amp;#150; AMOUNT DUE TO A 
DIRECTOR&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of June 30, 2015, the
director of&#13;the Company has advanced $10,000 for the payment of 
administrative expenses., The amount is unsecured, bears no interest and 
is&#13;payable upon demand.&lt;/p&gt;</APLL:DueToDirectorDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 7 &amp;#150; COMMON 
STOCK&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
September 30, 2013, the Company issued&#13;1,875,000 shares of restricted common
stock at $0.08 per share for a private placement of 
$150,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
December 1, 2013, the Company issued&#13;200,000 shares of restricted common 
stock at $0.08 per share for the rendering of business consulting services of 
$16,000. As of&#13;December 1, 2013, the current value was $0.23 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 1, 2013, the
Company issued&#13;100,000 shares of restricted common stock at $0.23 per share 
for the rendering of business consulting services of $23,000. As of&#13;December
1, 2013, the current market value was $0.23 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
December 4, 2013, the Company issued&#13;5,000,000 shares of restricted common 
stock at $0.20 per share for a private placement of 
$1,000,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 11, 2013, 
the Company issued&#13;6,000,000 shares of restricted common stock at $0.20 per 
share in lieu of $1,200,000 consideration for the acquisition of 70% 
interest&#13;in three gold exploration claims in the PRC. As of December 11, 
2013, the current market value was $0.25 per share. On January&#13;19, 2015, the
Company and Yinfu mutually agreed to terminate the acquisition and cancel all 
6,000,000 shares at the current market&#13;value of $0.10 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 23, 2013, 
the Company issued&#13;8,000,000 shares of restricted common stock at $0.375 per
share plus $1,000,000 in cash for the acquisition of 24% equity interest&#13;in
Everenergy with an aggregated consideration of $4,000,000. As of December 23, 
2013, the current market value was $0.33 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
February 11, 2014, the Company issued&#13;100,000 shares of restricted common 
stock at $0.45 per share for the rendering of business consulting services of 
$45,000. As of&#13;February 11, 2014, the current market value was $0.45 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 19, 2014, 
the Company issued&#13;11,000,000 shares of restricted common stock at $0.45 per
share for the acquisition of additional 29% equity interest in Everenergy&#13;in
a consideration of $4,950,000. As of February 19, 2014, the current market value
was $0.35 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 16, 2014, the 
Company issued&#13;653,823 shares of restricted common stock at $0.20 per share 
to settle a debt of $130,764 owed to the Chief Executive Officer 
and&#13;director of the Company. As of June 16, 2014, the current market value 
was $0.15 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On
September 17, 2014, the Board of&#13;Directors approved the cancellation of the 
total 19,000,000 shares of restricted common stocks issued for the acquisition 
of equity&#13;interest in Everenergy at a current market value of $0.12 per 
share. The 11,000,000 shares issued to Mr. Hu were effectively cancelled&#13;on 
October 21, 2014 and the remaining 8,000,000 shares issued to Mr. Tang are to be
cancelled as of June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
6.95pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 12, 
2015, the Company issued&#13;700,000 shares of restricted common stock at $0.10 
per share to settle a debt of $70,000 owed to the Chief Executive Officer 
and&#13;director of the Company. As of February 12, 2015, the current market 
value was $0.10 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 4, 2015, the 
Company issued&#13;6,000,000 shares of restricted common stock at $0.10 per 
share for the rendering of business and strategic consulting services&#13;of 
$600,000 in a service period of twelve months commencing from June 2015. For the
year ended June 30, 2015, the Company amortized&#13;$50,000 to the operations 
using the straight-line method. As of June 30, 2015, the deferred expenditure is
recorded as $550,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
6.95pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 9, 2015, the
Company issued&#13;400,000 shares of restricted common stock at $0.10 per share 
for the rendering of administrative consulting services of $40,000.&#13;As of 
June 9, 2015, the current market value was $0.10 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 26, 2015, the 
Board of Directors&#13;of the Company approved to issue 340,000 shares of 
restricted common stock at $0.15 per share to settle a debt of $51,000 
owed&#13;to the Chief Executive Officer and director of the Company. All 340,000
shares were issued subsequently on July 2, 2015. As of&#13;June 26, 2015, the 
current market value was $0.16 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;There were no stock options, warrants&#13;or other potentially 
dilutive securities outstanding as at June 30, 2015 and 
2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of June 30, 2015 
there are 21,872,118&#13;shares of common stock issued and 
outstanding.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>

0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company is 
registered in the State&#13;of Nevada and is subject to the tax laws of the 
United States of America. As of June 30, 2015, the operations in the United 
States&#13;of America incurred $15,436,319 of cumulative net operating losses 
which can be carried forward to offset future taxable income.&#13;The net 
operating loss carryforwards begin to expire in the year 2017 through 2034, if 
unutilized. The Company has provided for&#13;a full valuation allowance of 
$3,859,080 against the deferred tax assets on the expected future
 tax benefits from the net operating&#13;loss carryforwards as the management 
believes it is more likely than not that these assets will not be realized in 
the future.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2014-
07-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 9 &amp;#150; RELATED PARTY 
TRANSACTIONS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;During the year ended 
June 30, 2015,&#13;Mr. Kelvin Chak, the CEO and director of the Company paid a 
total of $50,596 for general expenses and management fees of $25,482&#13;and 
$25,114, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 12, 2015, 
the Company issued&#13;700,000 shares of restricted common stocks at $0.10 per 
share to settle a debt of $70,000 owed to the CEO and director of the 
Company&#13;at the current market value of $0.10 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 13, 2015, 
the Company disposed&#13;its 100% equity interest in Apolo Gold Direct Limited 
(formerly known as Apolo Gold &amp;#38; Energy Asia Limited) to (i) Mr. 
Kelvin&#13;Chak Wai Man, the Chief Executive Officer (&amp;#147;CEO&amp;#148;) 
and director of the Company, who acquired 40% equity interest, (ii)&#13;Mr. Tsap
Wai Ping, the brother of the CEO of the Company, who acquired 50% equity 
interest, and (iii) China Yi Gao Gold Trader&#13;Co., Limited, a company 
incorporated in Hong Kong, which acquired the remaining 10% equity interest, for
a consideration of $100.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 4, 2015, the 
Company issued&#13;2,000,000 shares of restricted common stocks at $0.10 per 
share for the rendering of business consulting services provided by
the&#13;brother of the CEO and director of the Company at the current market 
value of $0.11 per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 9, 2015, the 
Company issued&#13;200,000 shares of restricted common stocks at $0.10 per share
for the rendering of administrative consulting services provided&#13;by the 
Chief Financial Officer of the Company at the current market value of $0.22 per 
share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 26, 2015, the 
Board of Directors&#13;of the Company approved to issue 340,000 shares of 
restricted common stock at $0.15 per share to settle a debt of $51,000 
owed&#13;to the CEO and director of the Company at the current market value of 
$0.16 per share. All 340,000 shares were issued subsequently&#13;on July 2, 
2015.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>

    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 11 &amp;#150; SUBSEQUENT 
EVENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In accordance with ASC 
Topic 855, &amp;#147;Subsequent&#13;Events&amp;#148;, which establishes general 
standards of accounting for and disclosure of events that occur after the 
balance sheet&#13;date but before financial statements are issued, the Company 
has evaluated all events or transactions that occurred after June&#13;30, 2015 
up through the date the Company issued the audited consolidated financial 
statements. There were no subsequent events&#13;that required recognition or 
disclosure.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basis of presentation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial&#13;statements are prepared 
in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States
of America (&amp;#147;US&#13;GAAP&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p 
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Estimates&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Management 
uses estimates and assumptions&#13;in preparing these financial statements in 
accordance with US GAAP. Those estimates and assumptions affect the reported 
amounts&#13;of assets and liabilities, the disclosure of contingent assets and
liabilities in the balance sheet, and the reported revenue&#13;and expenses 
during the periods reported. Actual results may differ from these 
estimates.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>

    <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash and cash 
equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cash and cash 
equivalents are carried&#13;at cost and represent cash on hand, demand deposits 
placed with banks or other financial institutions and all highly liquid 
investments&#13;with an original maturity of three months or less as of the 
purchase date of such investments.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:InvestmentPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Investments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Affiliated 
companies, in which the&#13;Company has significant influence, but no control, 
are accounted for investment. Investment adjustments include the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;proportionate share of investee income or loss, gains or 
losses resulting from investee capital transactions, adjustments to 
recognize&#13;certain differences between the Company&amp;#146;s carrying value 
and the Company&amp;#146;s equity in net assets of the investee at&#13;the date 
of investment, impairments, and other adjustments required by the equity method.
Gain or losses are realized when such&#13;investments are sold.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:InvestmentPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CompensationRelatedCostsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Stock-based compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company adopts FASB Accounting&#13;Standards Codification Topic 
718, &lt;i&gt;Compensation &amp;#150; Stock Compensation &lt;/i&gt;
(&amp;#147;ASC Topic 718&amp;#148;) using the fair&#13;value method. Under ASC 
Topic 718, the stock-based compensation is measured using the Black-Scholes 
Option-Pricing model on the&#13;date of grant under the modified prospective 
method. The fair value of stock-based compensation that are expected to vest
are&#13;recognized using the straight-line method over the requisite service 
period.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CompensationRelatedCostsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Income taxes are determined in accordance&#13;with the provisions of
ASC Topic 740, &amp;#147;Income Taxes&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASC Topic 
740&amp;#148;). Under this method, deferred tax&#13;assets and liabilities are 
recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between 
the financial statement&#13;carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities 
and their respective tax basis. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are 
measured&#13;using enacted income tax rates expected to apply to taxable income 
in the periods in which those temporary differences are expected&#13;to be 
recovered or settled. Any effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a 
change in tax rates is recognized in income&#13;in the period that includes the 
enactment date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;ASC 740 prescribes a 
comprehensive&#13;model for how companies should recognize, measure, present, 
and disclose in their financial statements uncertain tax positions&#13;taken or 
expected to be taken on a tax return. Under ASC 740, tax positions must 
initially be recognized in the financial statements&#13;when it is more likely 
than not the position will be sustained upon examination by the tax authorities.
Such tax positions must&#13;initially and subsequently be measured as the 
largest amount of tax benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being 
realized&#13;upon ultimate settlement with the tax authority assuming full 
knowledge of the position and relevant facts.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-
06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Net loss per share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company calculates net loss per&#13;share in accordance with ASC
Topic 260, &lt;i&gt;&amp;#147;Earnings per Share.&amp;#148;&lt;/i&gt; Basic loss
per share is computed by dividing&#13;the net loss by the weighted-average 
number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted income per share 
is computed&#13;similar to basic loss per share except that the denominator is 
increased to include the number of additional common shares that&#13;would have 
been outstanding if the potential common stock equivalents had been issued and 
if the additional common shares were&#13;dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ComprehensiveIncomePolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Comprehensive income&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;ASC Topic 220, &amp;#147;Comprehensive&#13;Income&amp;#148;, 
establishes standards for reporting and display of comprehensive income, its 
components and accumulated balances.&#13;Comprehensive income as defined 
includes all changes in equity during a period from non-owner sources. 
Accumulated other comprehensive&#13;income, as presented in the accompanying 
consolidated statement of stockholders&amp;#146; equity, consists of changes in 
unrealized&#13;gains and losses on foreign currency translation. This 
comprehensive income is not included in the computation of income tax
expense&#13;or benefit.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ComprehensiveIncomePolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <APLL:RelatedPartiesPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-
30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Related parties&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Parties, which can be a corporation&#13;or individual, are 
considered to be related if the Company has the ability, directly or indirectly,
to control the other party&#13;or exercise significant influence over the other 
party in making financial and operating decisions. Companies are also 
considered&#13;to be related if they are subject to common control or common 
significant influence.&lt;/p&gt;</APLL:RelatedPartiesPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy contextRef="From2014-07-
01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair value of financial 
instruments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The carrying value of 
the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;financial instruments: cash and cash equivalents, 
subscription receivable, notes receivable, accounts payable and loans from 
related&#13;parties approximate at their fair values because of the short-term 
nature of these financial instruments.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-
indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company 
also follows the guidance&#13;of the ASC Topic 820-10, &amp;#147;Fair Value 
Measurements and Disclosures&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASC 820-10&amp;#148;), with 
respect to financial&#13;assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value.
ASC 820-10 establishes a three-tier fair value hierarchy that 
prioritizes&#13;the inputs used in measuring fair value as 
follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
31.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Level 1&lt;/i&gt;: Observable&#13;inputs such as quoted 
prices in active markets;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Level 2&lt;/i&gt;: Inputs, other&#13;than the quoted prices
in active markets, that are observable either directly or indirectly; 
and&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Level 3&lt;/i&gt;: Unobservable&#13;inputs in 
which there is little or no market data, which require the reporting entity to 
develop its own assumptions.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy>
    <us-gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Foreign currency 
translation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Transactions denominated
in currencies&#13;other than the functional currency are translated into the 
functional currency at the exchange rates prevailing at the dates of&#13;the 
transaction. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other
than the functional currency are translated into&#13;the functional currency 
using the applicable exchange rates at the balance sheet dates. The resulting 
exchange differences are&#13;recorded in the statement of 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The reporting currency 
of the Company&#13;is United States Dollars (&amp;#147;US$&amp;#148;) and the 
accompanying financial statements have been expressed in US$. In 
addition,&#13;the Company&amp;#146;s former subsidiary in Hong Kong maintains 
its books and record in its local currency, Hong Kong Dollars 
(&amp;#147;HK$&amp;#148;),&#13;which is functional currency as being the primary
currency of the economic environment in which the entity 
operates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In general, for 
consolidation purposes,&#13;assets and liabilities of its subsidiaries whose 
functional currency is not US$ are translated into US$, in accordance with 
ASC&#13;Topic 830-30, &amp;#147;Translation of Financial Statement&amp;#148;, 
using the exchange rate on the balance sheet date. Revenues and&#13;expenses are
translated at average rates prevailing during the period. The gains and losses 
resulting from translation of financial&#13;statements of foreign subsidiary are
recorded as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income 
within the statement&#13;of stockholders&amp;#146; equity. The gains and losses 
are recorded as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive 
income&#13;within the statement of stockholders&amp;#146; 
equity.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Translation of amounts 
from HK$ into&#13;US$1 has been made at the following exchange rates for the 
respective periods:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; width: 100%; 
border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; line-height:

height: 115%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="6" style="border-
bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 115%"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;June 
30,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; line-

rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; line-height:

align: right; line-height: 115%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;7.7511&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%;
line-height: 115%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="line-height: 115%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;Year-average HK$ : US$1 exchange rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    
&lt;td style="line-height: 115%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; line-height: 
115%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt
double; text-align: right; line-height: 115%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;7.7533&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="line-height: 115%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-
height: 115%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: 
black 2.25pt double; line-height: 115%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right; line-height: 
115%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;7.7528&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 
115%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;u&gt;Recent accounting 
pronouncements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;FASB issues various 
Accounting Standards&#13;Updates relating to the treatment and recording of 
certain accounting transactions. On June 10, 2014, the Financial 
Accounting&#13;Standards Board issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU) No. 
2014-10,Development Stage Entities (Topic 915) - Elimination of 
Certain&#13;Financial Reporting Requirements, Including an Amendment to Variable
Interest Entities Guidance in Topic 810, Consolidation, which&#13;eliminates the
concept of a development stage entity (DSE) entirely from current accounting 
guidance. The Company has elected adoption&#13;of this standard, which 
eliminates the designation of DSEs and the requirement to disclose results of 
operations and cash flows&#13;since inception.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company has reviewed all recently&#13;issued, but not yet 
effective, accounting pronouncements and do not believe the future adoption of 
any such pronouncements may&#13;be expected to cause a material impact on its 
financial condition or the results of its operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
</xbrli:xbrl>
</XBRL>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>15
<FILENAME>report.css
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */
/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
background-color: #def;
border: 2px solid #2F4497;
font-size: 1em;
position: absolute;
}
..report table.authRefData a {
display: block;
font-weight: bold;
}
..report table.authRefData p {
margin-top: 0px;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide {
background-color: #2F4497;
padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
text-align: right;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
background-color: #2F4497;
}
..report table.authRefData .body {
height: 150px;
overflow: auto;
width: 400px;
}
..report table.authRefData table{
font-size: 1em;
}
/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
color: black;
text-decoration: none;
/* table */
..report {
background-color: white;
border: 2px solid #acf;
clear: both;
color: black;
font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
margin-bottom: 2em;
}
}
}
..report hr {
border: 1px solid #acf;
}
/* Top labels */
..report th {
background-color: #acf;
color: black;
font-weight: bold;
text-align: center;
..report th.void {
background-color: transparent;
color: #000000;
font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
text-align: left;
}
..report .pl {
text-align: left;
vertical-align: top;
white-space: normal;
width: 200px;
white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}
..report td.pl a.a {
cursor: pointer;
display: block;
width: 200px;
overflow: hidden;
}
..report td.pl div.a {
width: 200px;
}
..report td.pl a:hover {
background-color: #ffc;
}
/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
background-color: #acf;
color: black;
font-weight: bold;
}
/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
background-color: #f0f0f0;
}
/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
background-color: #def;
}
..report .reu td {
border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
background-color: white;
}
..report .rou td {
border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}
/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
white-space: nowrap;
}
/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
text-align: right;
white-space: nowrap;
}
..report .nump {
padding-left: 2em;
}
..report .nump {
padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}
/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
text-align: left;
white-space: normal;
}
..report .text .big {
margin-bottom: 1em;
width: 17em;
}
..report .text .more {
display: none;
}
..report .text .note {
font-style: italic;
font-weight: bold;
}
..report .text .small {
width: 10em;
}
..report sup {
font-style: italic;
}
..report .outerFootnotes {
font-size: 1em;
}
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<span style="display: none;">v3.2.0.727</span><table class="report" border="0" 
cellspacing="2" id="idm140031452693696">
<tr>
<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>Going 
Concern Uncertainties<br></strong></div></th>
<th class="th" colspan="1">12 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
<tr><th class="th"><div>Jun. 30, 2015</div></th></tr>
<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_APLL_GoingConcernUncertaintiesAbstract', window );"><strong>Going 
Concern Uncertainties</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl custom" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_APLL_GoingConcernUncertaintiesDisclosureTextBlock', window );">Going 
Concern Uncertainties</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="margin: 0pt"></p><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><b>NOTE 2 &#150; GOING 
CONCERN UNCERTAINTIES</b></p><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p><p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">The accompanying consolidated financialstatements have been prepared 
assuming that the Company will continue as a going concern. As of June 30, 2015,
the Company sufferedan accumulated deficit of $15,436,321 and the Company had 
generated limited revenue and had no committed sources of capital orfinancing 
for the reporting period.</p><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p><p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">These consolidated financial statementshave been prepared assuming that
the Company will continue as a going concern, which contemplates the realization
of assets andthe discharge of liabilities in the normal course of business for 
the foreseeable future.</p><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p><p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">As of June 30, 2015, the Company sufferedthe accumulated deficits of 
$15,436,321 from prior years and suffered from a working capital deficit of 
$20,288. The continuationof the Company as a going concern is dependent upon the
continuing financial support from its stockholders or external financing.
Management believes the existing stockholders will provide the additional cash 
to meet with the Company&#146;s obligations asthey become due. However, there 
can be no assurance that the Company will be able to obtain sufficient funds to
meet its obligations.</p><p style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p><p 
style="font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">These factors raise substantial doubtabout the Company&#146;s ability 
to continue as a going concern. These consolidated financial statements do not 
include any adjustmentsto reflect the possible future effects on the 
recoverability and classification of assets or the amounts and classification of
liabilities that may result in the Company not being able to continue as a going
concern.</p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CommonStockSharesIssued">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total number of common shares of an entity that have been
sold or granted to shareholders (includes common shares that were issued, 
repurchased and remain in the treasury). These shares represent capital invested
by the firm's shareholders and owners, and may be all or only a portion of the 
number of shares authorized. Shares issued include shares outstanding and shares
held in the treasury.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

</tr>
</table></div>
</div></td></tr>

expected to be charged against earnings within one year or the normal operating

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_StockRepurchasedDuringPeriodShares">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Number of shares that have been repurchased during the 
period and have not been retired and are not held in treasury. Some state laws 
may govern the circumstances under which an entity may acquire its own stock and
prescribe the accounting treatment therefore. This element is used when state 
law does not recognize treasury stock.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br><br><br> -Publisher
